cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SSE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, expected to turn NW then NNW, passing near or over western Cuba Monday night–early Tuesday, then entering the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and aiming toward Florida’s west coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba (Pinar del Río/Isla de la Juventud area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Cuban provinces of Isla de Juventud, Pinar del Río and Artemisa; Tropical Storm Watch for Little Cayman, Cayman Brac, and parts of western Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Grand Cayman and parts of western Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: western Caribbean, western Cuba, southeastern Gulf of Mexico, Florida peninsula (mainly west and central sections), and eventually portions of the Southeast U.S. coast
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 24% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds, beginning late Tuesday night–Wednesday and peaking Wednesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast; primary surge threat remains on Florida’s Gulf side.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with localized amounts up to 6 inches through Wednesday, which may cause periods of urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf beginning mid-week, possible brief tornadoes in outer rain bands.
